channel.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
channel.description:
So, I'm interested in knowing what everyone's FIRST video game was...and how old you were. Like I mentioned in the title however, arcade machines do not count...unless it was a port to a home console.
IDK but I may be unique, my first video game was the classic Sierra action/adventure game [url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Quest']Space Quest[/url]. I was 1 year old when it was released and I remember sitting at my father's "swan" computer playing the series with my older bother. When I was finally old enough to actually use the keyboard and play on my own, I was so young he had to make me cheat sheets with all the specific commands to get through the game (If you ever played those classic sierra games, you know the commands can be a little picky). I grew up with the entire series...I was 10 when SQ6 was released and was devastated when they canceled SQ7. I feel I was lucky to have grown up during the adventure gaming era, they are perfect for that age.
In addition the the SQ series, I also played [url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Colonel%27s_Bequest']The Colonel's Bequest[/url], another sierra adventure game...I still remember getting "super sleuth" for the first time. I also had an NES, but my roots are on the PC.
So...what about you?

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: Mateuuuusz
item.description:
Half-Life or Montezuma . I was a little kid then, i don’t remember.

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Let’s see if I can list off my first video games (all before the NES).

Pong.

Atari 2600: Air-Sea Battle, River Raid, Pac-Man, Megamania, Circus Atari, Asteroids, Berzerk, Empire Strikes Back, Bowling, Burgertime, Centipede, Chopper Command, Stampede!, Defender, Pitfall!, Dig Dug, Donkey Kong, Donkey Kong Jr, Keystone Kapers, Kaboom, Frogger, Tapper, Grand Prix, Joust, Pole Position, Q*Bert.

Atari 5200: Congo Bongo, Mario Brothers, Popeye, Qix, Robotron 2084

Atari 7800: Kung Fu Master, Ms. Pac Man, Q*bert, Rampage, Xevious

ColecoVision: BC’s Quest For Tires, Burger Time, Dig Dug, Frogger, Smurf Paint and Play, Smurf: Rescue from Gargamel’s Castle

…I think that’s it. Gah, too many games! Too many good memories!

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
I don’t think I’ve posted in this thread yet…

My first game ever was probably a Mario game on the SNES.

It wasn’t until Super Mario 64 that I really got into gaming though so I usually think of that one as the first.

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
Big Rigs Over the Road Racing…

…IS THE MOST [COLOR=‘Red’]A[COLOR=‘Orange’]M[COLOR=‘Yellow’]A[COLOR=‘Lime’]Z[COLOR=‘Blue’]I[COLOR=‘Indigo’]N[COLOR=‘Purple’]G GAME EVER CREATED! :3

[COLOR=‘DimGray’]By just watching that video I think I can tell how they programmed every aspect of that so called “physics engine.” And $10 says it’s under 50 lines of code.

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: Payne_and_Redemption
item.description:
Of course, my first game ever had to be the classic ET for Atari 2600. That, Superman 64 and Big Rigs Over the Road Racing are just 3 of the classic games that recieve such low scores. I mean, how could you not like them? They clearly deserve better than the 10 that reviews give them

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: Stargategeek
item.description:
Ah the memories, sitting in front of the TV with my familiy playing on the NES with the awww’ing of people as you fall down a endless pit to your most shamefull death as u strive to complete the game… ahhh Super mario bros was awesome… in a weird jumping on mushrooms kind of way O_o

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: JerseyRyan
item.description:
It’s hard to remember which was the first one but I think it was Super Mario Bros. for NES. My uncle gave me his Amiga 500 back then and I remember playing Lotus Turbo Challange 2, F/A-18 Flight Simulator and Zack McCracken and the Alien Mindbenders on it. As well as other AMAZING stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Commander Keen : Secret of the Oracle[/SIZE]
I was obessed with this game series for half of my childhood. I downloaded a ton of mods and addons… I even had a copy of the non-released but finished 6th episode of the game.

You can get Secret of the Oracle here. The others you have to pirate; 4 is sharware. It’s a very small download.

item.title: Your first videogame (not arcade)
item.dc:creator: GreyMatter
item.description:
My first true video game was either King’s Quest V, Oregon Trail 2, or Lemmings. Before that, I’d spend hours dicking around with AfterDark; if you know what that is, you probably just felt a massive wave of nostalgia.

My first FPS: Half-Life! :freeman:

Read full topic
